When a load-balanced queue is configured with N (N > 0) SNs, it is given a slot in a sequence number group configured for N SNs per queue.  Release one or more events. Every event received by a load-balanced port has to be released; this tells the DLB that the port is done processing the event. Releases apply to events in the order in which events are received; that is, each release applies to the oldest unreleased event received on the port that issues the release. More...

 Forward one or more events. A forward is equivalent to sending a new event followed by a release. More...
 
int dlb_pop_cq (dlb_port_hdl_t hdl, uint32_t num)
 Pop the CQ one or more times. Every event received for a port occupies a location in its CQ, and the pop clears space for more events to be scheduled to the port. Each pop is applied to the oldest event in the CQ. More...

 Receive one or more events, and pop the CQ for each event received. The wait argument determines whether the function waits for at least one event or not. Received events must be processed in order. More...

Detailed Description

DLB Client API.

This API supports enables the configuration and use of the DLB for hardware-accelerated queue scheduling and core-to-core communication.

Typedef Documentation

◆ dlb_create_sched_domain_t

typedef struct dlb_create_sched_domain dlb_create_sched_domain_t

DLB scheduling domain creation arguments.

See also
dlb_resources_t

Enumeration Type Documentation

◆ dlb_alert_id_t

enum dlb_alert_id_t

DLB alert IDs.

Enumerator
DLB_ALERT_DEVICE_RESET 

The device containing this domain is being reset. When this occurs, libdlb disables all ports, blocking the application from enqueueing or dequeueing (indicated by error code EACCES). The application needs to detach all its handles and call dlb_close(), or simply exit and restart.

The alert data doesn't contain any information for this alert.

DLB_ALERT_DOMAIN_RESET 

The domain is being reset, triggered by a call to dlb_reset_sched_domain(). The application doesn't need to take any action in response to this alert. The alert data doesn't contain any information for this alert.

◆ dlb_api_class_t

enum dlb_api_class_t

API classes.

Enumerator
DLB_API_CLASS_RECV 

Applies to all functions prefixed with dlb_recv.

◆ dlb_port_cos_ids_t

enum dlb_port_cos_ids_t

Load-balanced port class-of-service IDs.

Enumerator
DLB_PORT_COS_ID_0 

Class-of-service 0

DLB_PORT_COS_ID_1 

Class-of-service 1

DLB_PORT_COS_ID_2 

Class-of-service 2

DLB_PORT_COS_ID_3 

Class-of-service 3

DLB_PORT_COS_ID_ANY 

Any class-of-service

◆ dlb_wait_profile_type_t

enum dlb_wait_profile_type_t

Wait profile wait types.

Enumerator
DLB_WAIT_INTR 

Suspend the thread until the interrupt fires or the port is disabled.

DLB_WAIT_INTR_LOW_POWER 

Put the core in low-power mode until the interrupt fires, a timeout is reached, or the port is disabled. To maximize power savings, the user should configure their system to minimize interrupts (timer, network, etc.) on this core.

DLB_WAIT_TIMEOUT_HARD_POLL 

Continuously poll until an event is available, the timeout is reached, or the port is disabled.

DLB_WAIT_TIMEOUT_SLEEP_POLL 

Poll until an event is available, the timeout is reached, or the port is disabled, sleeping for a user-specified duration after every unsuccessful poll.

Function Documentation

◆ dlb_attach_dir_port()

dlb_port_hdl_t dlb_attach_dir_port ( dlb_domain_hdl_t  hdl,
int  port_id 
)

Attach to a previously created directed port. The handle returned is used to send and receive events.

Note
A process can attach to a port created by another process. A port handle cannot be shared among processes, but can be shared among threads within the caller process.
Nearly all functions that take a port handle are not MT-safe (these functions are documented as such). It is invalid to simultaneously run any non-MT-safe datapath functions (e.g., dlb_send and dlb_recv()) with the same port handle. Multiple threads within a single process can share a port handle, so long as the application provides mutual exclusion around the datapath functions.
Parameters
[in]hdldomain handle returned by a successful call to dlb_attach_sched_domain().
[in]port_iddirected port ID.
Return values
>0 Success, returned a port handle
NULLFailure, and errno is set according to the exceptions listed below
Exceptions
EINVALInvalid domain handle
EINVALInvalid port ID

◆ dlb_attach_ldb_port()

dlb_port_hdl_t dlb_attach_ldb_port ( dlb_domain_hdl_t  hdl,
int  port_id 
)

Attach to a previously created load-balanced port. The handle returned is used to send and receive events.

Note
A process can attach to a port created by another process. A port handle cannot be shared among processes, but can be shared among threads within the caller process.
Nearly all functions that take a port handle are not MT-safe (these functions are documented as such). It is invalid to simultaneously run any non-MT-safe datapath functions (e.g., dlb_send and dlb_recv()) with the same port handle. Multiple threads within a single process can share a port handle, so long as the application provides mutual exclusion around the datapath functions.
Parameters
[in]hdldomain handle returned by a successful call to dlb_attach_sched_domain().
[in]port_idload-balanced port ID.
Return values
>0 Success, returned a port handle
NULLFailure, and errno is set according to the exceptions listed below
Exceptions
EINVALInvalid domain handle
EINVALInvalid port ID

◆ dlb_attach_sched_domain()

dlb_domain_hdl_t dlb_attach_sched_domain ( dlb_hdl_t  hdl,
int  domain_id 
)

Attach to a previously created scheduling domain.

Note
A process can attach to a domain created by another process. A domain handle cannot be shared among processes, but can be shared among threads within the caller process.
Functions that take a domain handle are MT-safe, unless otherwise noted. When dlb_detach_sched_domain() is called for a particular DLB handle, that handle can no longer be used.
Parameters
[in]hdlHandle returned by a successful call to dlb_open().
[in]domain_idDomain ID returned by a successful call to dlb_create_sched_domain().
Return values
>0 Success, returned a domain handle
NULLFailure, and errno is set according to the exceptions listed below
Exceptions
EINVALInvalid domain ID or the scheduling domain is not configured
EPERMUnable to open or map the domain's shared memory file

◆ dlb_close()

int dlb_close ( dlb_hdl_t  hdl)

Clean up the client library and close the DLB device file associated with the DLB handle. The user must detach all scheduling domain handles attached with this handle before calling this function, else it will fail.

Parameters
[in]hdlHandle returned by a successful call to dlb_open().
Return values
0Success
-1Failure, and errno is set according to the exceptions listed below
Exceptions
EEXISTThere is at least one remaining attached domain handle
EINVALInvalid DLB handle

◆ dlb_create_credit_pool()

int dlb_create_credit_pool ( dlb_domain_hdl_t  hdl,
int  num_credits 
)

Create a credit pool. These credits are used by ports to enqueue events to queues.

Note
This function is only usable by devices with the combined_credits capability.
See also
dlb_get_dev_capabilities, dlb_dev_cap_t
Parameters
[in]hdldomain handle returned by a successful call to dlb_attach_sched_domain().
[in]num_creditsNumber of credits in the pool.
Return values
>=0Pool ID
-1Failure, and errno is set according to the exceptions listed below
Exceptions
EINVALInvalid domain handle
EINVALInsufficient credits available in the domain
EINVALFunction not supported for devices without the combined_credits capability

◆ dlb_create_dir_port()

int dlb_create_dir_port ( dlb_domain_hdl_t  hdl,
dlb_create_port_t *  args,
int  queue_id 
)

Create a directed port. This port can be used to enqueue events into load-balanced or directed queues, and to receive events from a directed queue.

Parameters
[in]hdldomain handle returned by a successful call to dlb_attach_sched_domain().
[in]argsPointer to port configuration arguments.
[in]queue_idDirected queue ID. If the port's corresponding directed port is already created, specify its ID here. Else this argument must be -1 to indicate that the port is being created before the queue.
Return values
>=0Port ID
-1Failure, and errno is set according to the exceptions listed below
Exceptions
EINVALInvalid domain handle
EINVALNULL args pointer
EINVALInvalid credit pool ID, or invalid CQ depth

◆ dlb_create_dir_queue()

int dlb_create_dir_queue ( dlb_domain_hdl_t  hdl,
int  port_id 
)

Create a directed queue. events sent to this queue are enqueued directly to a single port.

Parameters
[in]hdldomain handle returned by a successful call to dlb_attach_sched_domain().
[in]port_idDirected port ID. If the queue's corresponding directed port is already created, specify its ID here. Else this argument must be -1 to indicate that the queue is being created before the port.
Return values
>=0Queue ID. If port_id is not -1, the queue ID will be the same as the port ID.
-1Failure, and errno is set according to the exceptions listed below
Exceptions

◆ dlb_create_sched_domain()

int dlb_create_sched_domain ( dlb_hdl_t  hdl,
dlb_create_sched_domain_t *  args 
)

Create a scheduling domain with the resources specified by args. If successful, the function returns the domain ID.

Only the process that created the domain can reset it, and this process must remain active for the duration of the scheduling domain's lifetime.

Parameters
[in]hdlHandle returned by a successful call to dlb_open().
[in]argsPointer to dlb_create_sched_domain_t structure.
Return values
>=0Scheduling domain ID
-1Failure, and errno is set according to the exceptions listed below
Exceptions
EINVALInsufficient DLB resources to satisfy the request
EPERMUnable to create or size a shared memory file
EPERMUnable to unlink a previously created shared memory file
ENOMEMUnable to mmap the shared memory file

◆ dlb_detach_sched_domain()

int dlb_detach_sched_domain ( dlb_domain_hdl_t  hdl)

Detach a scheduling domain handle. The handle can no longer be used after it is detached. All port handles from a domain must be detached before detaching any domain handles.

Parameters
[in]hdldomain handle returned by a successful call to dlb_attach_sched_domain().
Return values
0Success
-1Failure, and errno is set according to the exceptions listed below
Exceptions
EINVALInvalid domain handle
EEXISTThere is at least one remaining attached port handle

◆ dlb_disable_port()

int dlb_disable_port ( dlb_port_hdl_t  hdl)

Disable event scheduling to the port and prevent threads from enqueueing to or dequeueing from the port. A disabled port can continue to dequeue any events remaining in the port's CQ when it was disabled, but the DLB will not schedule any additional events to the port until it is re-enabled. Attempts to dequeue from an empty disabled port will return an error.

Note
By default, ports are enabled.
If a thread is blocked in a DLB receive function call when the port is disabled, the thread will be unblocked and return.
This API can be called dynamically, i.e. after calling dlb_start_sched_domain().
Parameters
[in]hdlPort handle returned by a successful call to dlb_attach_ldb_port() or dlb_attach_dir_port().
Return values
0Success
-1Failure, and errno is set according to the exceptions listed below
Exceptions
EINVALInvalid port handle

◆ dlb_disable_port_sched()

int dlb_disable_port_sched ( dlb_port_hdl_t  hdl)

Disable event scheduling to the port. A disabled port can continue to enqueue events and dequeue any events remaining in the port's CQ when it was disabled, but the DLB will not schedule any additional events to the port until it is re-enabled.

Note
By default, ports are enabled.
If a thread is blocked in a DLB receive function call when the port is disabled, the thread will be unblocked and return.
After disabling a port, it may still have events in its CQ. It is the application's responsibility to drain the port's CQ after disabling it.
This API can be called dynamically, i.e. after calling dlb_start_sched_domain().
Parameters
[in]hdlPort handle returned by a successful call to dlb_attach_ldb_port() or dlb_attach_dir_port().
Return values
0Success
-1Failure, and errno is set according to the exceptions listed below
Exceptions
EINVALInvalid port handle

◆ dlb_enable_cq_epoll()

int dlb_enable_cq_epoll ( dlb_port_hdl_t  hdl,
bool  is_ldb,
int  efd 
)

Enable epoll support to monitor event file descriptors created for directed and load-balanced port's CQs. Kernel notifies user-space of events through the eventfds.

Application must create eventfds per CQ with EFD_NONBLOCK flag.

Parameters
[in]hdlPort handle.
[in]is_ldbTrue for load-balanced port and false for directed port.
[in]efdEvent file descriptor for the CQ.
Return values
0Success
-1Failure, and errno is set according to the exception listed below
Exceptions
EINVALInvalid port handle

◆ dlb_enable_cq_weight()

int dlb_enable_cq_weight ( dlb_port_hdl_t  hdl)

Enable weight-based scheduling for this port. If enabled, the event weight field allows the event sender to specify the number of CQ slots (1, 2, 4, or 8) that the event will occupy.

By default, weight-based scheduling is disabled for newly created ports.

Note
This function cannot be called after the domain is started
This function is only usable by devices with the qe_weight capability.
See also
dlb_get_dev_capabilities, dlb_dev_cap_t
Parameters
[in]hdlPort handle returned by a successful call to dlb_attach_ldb_port().
Return values
0Success
-1Failure, and errno is set according to the exceptions listed below
Exceptions
EINVALInvalid port handle
EINVALThe domain is already started
EINVALFunction not supported for devices without the qe_weight capability

◆ dlb_forward()

int dlb_forward ( dlb_port_hdl_t  hdl,
uint32_t  num,
dlb_event_t *  events 
)

Forward one or more events. A forward is equivalent to sending a new event followed by a release.

If the port has insufficient credits to send all num events, it will return early. Typically insufficient credits is a transient condition and the send should be retried; however, certain pipeline architectures can lead to deadlock. For such pipelines, the application, should have a finite retry count and if necessary release the events and continue processing the port's consumer queue.

TODO: Add a description of the deadlock scenarios. At least a warning.

Note
Datapath functions (dlb_send, dlb_recv, etc.) are not MT-safe on the same port. Datapath functions can be run simultaneously on multiple threads if each thread is using a unique port.
Parameters
[in]hdlPort handle returned by a successful call to dlb_attach_ldb_port() or dlb_attach_dir_port().
[in]numNumber of events pointed to by events.
[in]eventsPointer to an array of dlb_event_t structures.
Return values
>=0The return value indicates the number of forwarded events. Events are enqueued in array order.
-1Failure, and errno is set according to the exceptions listed below
Exceptions
EINVALevents pointer is NULL
EINVALInvalid port handle
EPERMThe scheduling domain isn't started
EACCESThe port is disabled

◆ dlb_get_ldb_sequence_number_occupancy()

int dlb_get_ldb_sequence_number_occupancy ( dlb_hdl_t  hdl,
unsigned int  group,
unsigned int *  num 
)

Get the occupancy (the number of in-use slots) of a sequence number group. Each sequence number (SN) group has one or more slots, depending on its configuration. I.e.:

  • If configured for 1024 SNs per queue, the group has 1 slot
  • If configured for 512 SNs per queue, the group has 2 slots ...
  • If configured for 32 SNs per queue, the group has 32 slots

A sequence number group slot is used when it is assigned to a domain in either PF or VM.

See also
dlb_set_ldb_sequence_number_allocation
dlb_get_ldb_sequence_number_allocation
Parameters
[in]hdlHandle returned by a successful call to dlb_open().
[in]groupSequence number group ID.
[out]numPointer to the group occupancy.
Return values
0Success
-1Failure, and errno is set according to the exceptions listed below
Exceptions
EINVALInvalid DLB handle
EINVALInvalid group ID or num is NULL

◆ dlb_launch_domain_alert_thread()

int dlb_launch_domain_alert_thread ( dlb_domain_hdl_t  hdl,
domain_alert_callback_t  callback,
void *  callback_arg 
)

This function launches a background thread that blocks waiting for scheduling domain alerts. The thread calls callback (if non-NULL) for every alert it receives.

Each libdlb application must launch a domain alert thread before starting the domain, and only one alert thread per domain is supported.

While blocking, the thread is put to sleep by the kernel and thus doesn't consume any CPU. Alerts are uncommon – typically only when an error occurs or during a reset – so this thread should not affect datapath performance.

The alert thread is destroyed when the scheduling domain is reset, or the application exits.

Only the process that created the domain may launch the alert thread.

Parameters
[in]hdldomain handle returned by a successful call to dlb_attach_sched_domain().
[out]callbackCallback function pointer. Can be NULL.
[out]callback_argCallback function argument. Can be NULL.
Return values
0Success
-1Failure, and errno is set according to the exceptions listed below
Exceptions
EINVALInvalid domain handle
EPERMThe calling process did not create the domain
EEXISTThe alert thread is already launched
See also
dlb_alert_id_t

◆ dlb_link_queue()

int dlb_link_queue ( dlb_port_hdl_t  hdl,
int  queue_id,
int  priority 
)

Link a load-balanced queue to a load-balanced port. Each load-balanced port can link up to 8 queues.

Note
This API can be called dynamically, i.e. after calling dlb_start_sched_domain().
Parameters
[in]hdlPort handle returned by a successful call to dlb_attach_ldb_port().
[in]queue_idLoad-balanced queue ID.
[in]priorityPriority. Must be between 0 and 8, inclusive, where 0 is the highest priority.
Return values
0Success
-1Failure, and errno is set according to the exceptions listed below
Exceptions
EINVALInvalid port handle, queue ID, or priority
EINVALThe port is already linked to 8 queues.

◆ dlb_open()

int dlb_open ( int  device_id,
dlb_hdl_t *  hdl 
)

Open the DLB device file and initialize the client library.

Note
A DLB handle can be shared among threads within a process, but cannot be used by multiple processes. Functions that take a DLB handle are MT-safe, unless otherwise noted. When dlb_close() is called for a particular DLB handle, that handle can no longer be used.
Parameters
[in]device_idThe ID of a DLB device file. That is, N in /dev/dlbN.
[out]hdlPointer to memory where a DLB handle will be stored.
Return values
0Success, hdl points to a valid DLB handle
-1Failure, and errno is set according to the exceptions listed below
Exceptions
ENOENTNo DLB device found
EINVALInvalid device ID or hdl pointer
EINVALClient library version is incompatible with the installed DLB driver

◆ dlb_pop_cq()

int dlb_pop_cq ( dlb_port_hdl_t  hdl,
uint32_t  num 
)

Pop the CQ one or more times. Every event received for a port occupies a location in its CQ, and the pop clears space for more events to be scheduled to the port. Each pop is applied to the oldest event in the CQ.

Note
dlb_recv() automatically pops the CQ for every received event, but dlb_recv_no_pop() does not. dlb_pop_cq() should only be used in conjunction with dlb_recv_no_pop().
Datapath functions (dlb_send, dlb_recv, etc.) are not MT-safe on the same port. Datapath functions can be run simultaneously on multiple threads if each thread is using a unique port.
Parameters
[in]hdlPort handle returned by a successful call to dlb_attach_ldb_port() or dlb_attach_dir_port().
[in]numNumber of CQ pop operations to perform.
Return values
>=0The return value indicates the number of successful pops.
-1Failure, and errno is set according to the exceptions listed below
Exceptions
EINVALInvalid port handle
EACCESThe port is disabled

◆ dlb_recv()

int dlb_recv ( dlb_port_hdl_t  hdl,
uint32_t  max,
bool  wait,
dlb_event_t *  events 
)

Receive one or more events, and pop the CQ for each event received. The wait argument determines whether the function waits for at least one event or not. Received events must be processed in order.

Note
All events received on a load-balanced port must be released with dlb_release() or dlb_forward(). The advanced send function can release the oldest event with the REL/REL_T commands, or can simultaneously release the oldest event and send a event with the FWD/FWD_T commands.
When wait is true and no events are available to receive, this handle's wait profile determines the manner in which the thread blocks.
Datapath functions (dlb_send, dlb_recv, etc.) are not MT-safe on the same port. Datapath functions can be run simultaneously on multiple threads if each thread is using a unique port.
Parameters
[in]hdlPort handle returned by a successful call to dlb_attach_ldb_port() or dlb_attach_dir_port().
[in]maxMaximum number of events to receive.
[in]waitIf false, the function receives as many events as it can, up to max or until the CQ is empty. If true, the function waits until the CQ contains at least one event, then receives as many events as it can, up to max or until the CQ is empty.
[out]eventsPointer to an array of dlb_event_t structures.
Return values
>=0The return value indicates the number of dequeued events.
-1Failure, and errno is set according to the exceptions listed below
Exceptions
EINVALInvalid port handle or NULL events pointer
EPERMThe scheduling domain isn't started
EACCESThe port is disabled and there are no events in its CQ
EINTRThe thread blocked on a CQ interrupt and returned early because the DLB was unexpectedly reset

◆ dlb_recv_no_pop()

int dlb_recv_no_pop ( dlb_port_hdl_t  hdl,
uint32_t  max,
bool  wait,
dlb_event_t *  events 
)

Receive one or more events. The wait argument determines whether the function waits for at least one event or not. Received events must be processed in order.

Receive one or more events. The wait argument determines whether the function waits for at least one event or not. Received events must be processed in order.

Note
The application may hold onto owed tokens to cause the CQ to have an effective depth less than its configured depth. However, if the port's owed CQ tokens > (CQ depth - 4), the DLB will NOT schedule any more events to the CQ. If this state is reached, the application must release tokens until owed tokens <= (CQ depth - 4).
All received events occupy space in the CQ that needs to be cleared to allow more events to be scheduled to the port. dlb_recv_no_pop() does not automatically pop the event; the user must call dlb_pop_cq() to do so. Alternatively, the advanced send function has ways to pop the CQ:
  • By sending a batch token return command (BAT_T)
  • By piggy-backing a single token return onto another enqueue command (NEW_T, FWD_T, COMP_T, or FRAG_T)
All events received on a load-balanced port must be released with dlb_release() or dlb_forward(). The advanced send function can release the oldest event with the REL/REL_T commands, or can simultaneously release the oldest event and send a event with the FWD/FWD_T commands.
When wait is true and no events are available to receive, this handle's wait profile determines the manner in which the thread blocks.
Datapath functions (dlb_send, dlb_recv, etc.) are not MT-safe on the same port. Datapath functions can be run simultaneously on multiple threads if each thread is using a unique port.
Parameters
[in]hdlPort handle returned by a successful call to dlb_attach_ldb_port() or dlb_attach_dir_port().
[in]maxMaximum number of events to receive.
[in]waitIf false, the function receives as many events as it can, up to max or until the CQ is empty. If true, the function waits until the CQ contains at least one event, then receives as many events as it can, up to max or until the CQ is empty.
[out]eventsPointer to an array of dlb_event_t structures.
Return values
>=0The return value indicates the number of dequeued events.
-1Failure, and errno is set according to the exceptions listed below
Exceptions
EINVALInvalid port handle or NULL events pointer
EPERMThe domain isn't started
EACCESThe port is disabled and there are no events in its CQ

◆ dlb_release()

int dlb_release ( dlb_port_hdl_t  hdl,
uint32_t  num 
)

Release one or more events. Every event received by a load-balanced port has to be released; this tells the DLB that the port is done processing the event. Releases apply to events in the order in which events are received; that is, each release applies to the oldest unreleased event received on the port that issues the release.

Releases sent from a directed port are dropped.

Note
Datapath functions (dlb_send, dlb_recv, etc.) are not MT-safe on the same port. Datapath functions can be run simultaneously on multiple threads if each thread is using a unique port.
Parameters
[in]hdlPort handle returned by a successful call to dlb_attach_ldb_port() or dlb_attach_dir_port().
[in]numNumber of releases to issue.
Return values
>=0The return value indicates the number of released events.
-1Failure, and errno is set according to the exceptions listed below
Exceptions
EINVALInvalid port handle
EPERMThe scheduling domain isn't started
EACCESThe port is disabled

◆ dlb_reset_sched_domain()

int dlb_reset_sched_domain ( dlb_hdl_t  hdl,
int  domain_id 
)

This function resets a configured scheduling domain, effectively undoing the effects of dlb_create_sched_domain(). The domain's resources (ports, queues, pools, etc.) are relinquished to the DLB driver, making them available to be re-allocated and reconfigured.

Prior to calling this function, all port and domain handles must be detached. This function wakes any threads blocked reading the domain's device file, causing them to return errno ENODEV.

Only the process that created the domain can reset it.

Parameters
[in]hdlHandle returned by a successful call to dlb_open().
[in]domain_idDomain ID returned by a successful call to dlb_create_sched_domain().
Return values
0Success
-1Failure, and errno is set according to the exceptions listed below
Exceptions
EINVALInvalid domain ID
EPERMThe calling process did not create the domain
EEXISTThere is at least one remaining attached domain or port handle

◆ dlb_send()

int dlb_send ( dlb_port_hdl_t  hdl,
uint32_t  num,
dlb_event_t *  events 
)

Send one or more new events. 

     If the port has insufficient credits to send all num events, it will
     return early. Typically insufficient credits is a transient
     condition and the send should be retried; however, certain pipeline
     architectures and credit pool configurations can lead to deadlock.
     Consequently, it is strongly recommended that the application have a
     finite retry count and if necessary release the events and continue
     processing the port's consumer queue. (Credits aren't consumed when
     releasing events.)
Note
Datapath functions (dlb_send, dlb_recv, etc.) are not MT-safe on the same port. Datapath functions can be run simultaneously on multiple threads if each thread is using a unique port.
Parameters
[in]hdlPort handle returned by a successful call to dlb_attach_ldb_port() or dlb_attach_dir_port().
[in]numNumber of events pointed to by events.
[in]eventsPointer to an array of dlb_event_t structures.
Return values
>=0The return value indicates the number of enqueued events. Events are enqueued in array order.
-1Failure, and errno is set according to the exceptions listed below
Exceptions
EINVALevents pointer is NULL
EINVALInvalid port handle, or invalid queue ID in events
EPERMThe scheduling domain isn't started
EACCESThe port is disabled

◆ dlb_set_ldb_sequence_number_allocation()

int dlb_set_ldb_sequence_number_allocation ( dlb_hdl_t  hdl,
unsigned int  group,
unsigned int  num 
)

Set the number of sequence numbers (SNs) per queue in an SN group. When a load-balanced queue is configured with N (N > 0) SNs, it is given a slot in a sequence number group configured for N SNs per queue. Each group has a total of 1024 SNs, so the number of slots in a group depends on the group's SN allocations. For example:

  • 64 SNs per queue => 16 slots
  • 128 SNs per queue => 8 slots ...
  • 1024 SNs per queue => 1 slot

If a queue is configured with N SNs, but the SN groups are either not configured for N SNs per queue or have no available slots, the queue configuration will fail.

Note
A group's sequence number allocations cannot be altered if 1+ of the group's slots are in use, therefore, this function can only be called before any slots of the group is assigned to a domain (when a domain is created, for example) or VF/VDEV.
Parameters
[in]hdlHandle returned by a successful call to dlb_open().
[in]groupSequence number group ID.
[in]numSequence numbers per queue.
Return values
0Success
-1Failure, and errno is set according to the exceptions listed below
Exceptions
EINVALInvalid DLB handle
EINVALInvalid group ID or sequence number allocation
EPERMThe sequence number allocation is locked and cannot be changed

◆ dlb_set_wait_profile()

int dlb_set_wait_profile ( dlb_port_hdl_t  hdl,
dlb_api_class_t  api_class,
dlb_wait_profile_t  profile 
)

Set the port handle's behavior when it blocks in a datapath function.

Note
The default wait profiles are:
  • DLB_API_CLASS_RECV: DLB_WAIT_INTR
This function is not MT-safe with respect to datapath functions. Unexpected behavior may result if the wait profile is changed while the port handle is used in a datapath function.
Parameters
[in]hdlPort handle returned by a successful call to dlb_attach_ldb_port() or dlb_attach_dir_port().
[in]api_classthe api_class of functions this profile will apply to.
[in]profilea structure specifying the manner in which blocking functions will behave when they block.
Return values
0Success
-1Failure, and errno is set according to the exceptions below
Exceptions
EINVALInvalid port handle, api_class, or profile

◆ dlb_start_sched_domain()

int dlb_start_sched_domain ( dlb_domain_hdl_t  hdl)

This function is called to indicated the end of the DLB configuration phase and beginning of the dataflow phase. Until this function is called, ports cannot send events, and after it is called the domain's resources cannot be configured (unless otherwise noted in the documentation).

Parameters

Return values

-1Failure, and errno is set according to the exceptions listed below
Exceptions

ESRCHThe domain alert thread hasn't launched. The application must call dlb_launch_domain_alert_thread() before starting the domain
See also
dlb_launch_domain_alert_thread()
